title: Customised Baskerville?
content:
Hi there,

I think this is a cut of baskerville with customised 'k' and cap 'd' but im just guessing so I was wondering if anyone knew it?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015191012/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_464.png) | 166.43 KB |
author: fionaoleary0

comments.content: Whatever it is, it's very "caslonish" so why not [Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015191012/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/adobe-caslon/) with swashes ( [/D](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015191012/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/caslon/italic/glyphs.html#glyphs/511582/339) and [/k](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015191012/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/caslon/italic/glyphs.html#glyphs/511582/333) available as stylistic alternates through OpenType features).
